Summary: Bright orange star-like drifting in formations
divs: sighting detailsmy two friends and i are out in his backyard. we are jumping on his trampoline when i look at tree line and see a star kind of thing in the sky but its brighter and drifting. one by one they come up from the trees. they appear to be like orange street lights, but they're way too high to be street lights. these three lights move in a rough line. they appear to be bigger than stars, glowing in a weird manner, but smaller than the moon. i'd say roughly 1\4 or 1\5 of the moon's size from where we were looking (not actually that size, but relative to it). anyhow, two more join the first three from behind the trees and form an elongated m shape. their motion slows down, and they are moving in various directions. after about three or four minutes, three of them condense into a tight straight line formation, much closer than what they were like before. after a little those three form into a triangle with the other two on the side. eventually, the triangle slowly fades away, the one of the other two fades, and then the last one fades some time after the rest. by the end, we were joined by my brother and father, so a total of five of us saw at least some of them. we were positioned in a way that we were looking to the moon in the south, and the flying objects were around 45 degrees to the left of the moon. their motion was not in the typical manner of airplanes, nor was their color and size. no smoke trails were visible. we captured some poor video and pictures.
